Articles.Content: can you add tweak scale to the cargo-bays? please

8 minutes ago, Acvila said:

can you add tweak scale to the cargo-bays? please

Make that request to the Tweakscale Team as they are the ones who make those patches.

I found a bug in the new legacy version which causes the J OMS unit to disappear.  This will be corrected in the next version but for now the fix is simple.  Open the j_oms.cfg file and replace PARTPART:NEEDS[OPT] with PART:NEEDS[OPT]

Just trying this mod for the 1st time. Very beautiful!

Having a small issue where loading any of the J cockpits causes my game to crash when moving to the runway. Doesn't occur with the J drone cores or the other format cockpits.

Hmmm not sure if OPT should be showing that name or not... can you try reinstalling it please.

On 3/12/2017 at 10:22 PM, stali79 said:

Hmmm not sure if OPT should be showing that name or not... can you try reinstalling it please.

Reinstalled and things are working fine. Thanks.

Just now, proteasome said:

Reinstalled and things are working fine. Thanks.

no worries
Moobein came out with a night texture for OPT parts, is there a way we can get a half "night" half "reg" texture pack to simulate a heat shield?

Just now, Gunslinger1 said:

Moobein came out with a night texture for OPT parts, is there a way we can get a half "night" half "reg" texture pack to simulate a heat shield?

I will look into it but I can't make any promises.  Chances are no as it would require photoshop skills above what I have as new assets would have to be put into the texture along the seam line.
I've been starting to realize a few ideas of my own for visuals for OPT parts.  (So far, only these engines.)I

17 hours ago, JadeOfMaar said:

I've been starting to realize a few ideas of my own for visuals for OPT parts.  (So far, only these engines.)I 

   

 

they look really cool man
@stali79 Thanks. I've changed them functionally too and made them into new/discreet parts: the J-60 SURGE and J-61 GAUGE.

Just now, JadeOfMaar said:

@stali79 Thanks. I've changed them functionally too and made them into new/discreet parts: the J-60 SURGE and J-61 GAUGE.

nice. any changes to the models themselves?
No, I don't have the capacity to make or edit a part model. If only I could... But that's not going to change for a few months.
If it's just a retexture of existing parts, maybe it can be included in the next update?

13 minutes ago, King Something said:

If it's just a retexture of existing parts, maybe it can be included in the next update?

probably not the main pack, but doable for legacy

They would be quite fit for an include but I don't know how Sir Yeon would feel about them being described as being resurrected by another far future science and engineering conglomerate and leased back to/under the OPT name.

Spoiler

These engines sacrifice any typical combustion chamber for a Trek-inspired magnetic coil shaft. They'll consume insane EC and IntakeAtm at peak performance but will operate without Oxygen and are meant to make a few impossible things possible.

1 minute ago, JadeOfMaar said:

They would be quite fit for an include but I don't know how Sir Yeon would feel about them being described as being resurrected by another far future science and engineering conglomerate and leased back to/under the OPT name.

  Hide contents

These engines sacrifice any typical combustion chamber for a Trek-inspired magnetic coil shaft. They'll consume insane EC and IntakeAtm at peak performance but will operate without Oxygen and are meant to make a few impossible things possible. 

 

Its an interesting concept for them, so I would suggest put them VERY high up the tech tree, but he has pretty much given me full control of the legacy pack. I am happy to include them.

35 minutes ago, stali79 said:

Its an interesting concept for them, so I would suggest put them VERY high up the tech tree, but he has pretty much given me full control of the legacy pack. I am happy to include them.

I'm going the whole nine yards with these things. They already have a new place in th Community Tech Tree (but yes, not high enough. Dark Drive is still way ahead of them). I even want to change their sounds, maybe give the J-92 thrust sounds to the J-60, and set entirely different toggle and flameout sounds.

2 minutes ago, JadeOfMaar said:

I'm going the whole nine yards with these things. They already have a new place in th Community Tech Tree (but yes, not high enough. Dark Drive is still way ahead of them). I even want to change their sounds, maybe give the J-92 thrust sounds to the J-60, and set entirely different toggle and flameout sounds.

sounds good man. once you have them complete send them to me and I will have a play with them

Speaking of the older Mk2 engines, does anyone else want to separate them performance and mass-wise, or is it just me?

Right now, the only difference between the two is the overall length of the two engines, they both perform and mass exactly the same, so the only reason to pick one over the other is aesthetics. I'd love for them to have distinctly different behaviors and performance, so you'd have a greater reason to choose between them...

9 minutes ago, Winchester said:

Speaking of the older Mk2 engines, does anyone else want to separate them performance and mass-wise, or is it just me?

Right now, the only difference between the two is the overall length of the two engines, they both perform and mass exactly the same, so the only reason to pick one over the other is aesthetics. I'd love for them to have distinctly different behaviors and performance, so you'd have a greater reason to choose between them...

 

I suck at tuning them, so if you can suggest better tunings for the shorter engine then I am happy to test them and incorporate them into legacy

1 minute ago, stali79 said:

I suck at tuning them, so if you can suggest better tunings for the shorter engine then I am happy to test them and incorporate them into legacy

I suck just as bad, to be honest. I just want someone who *doesn't* suck to know that this is a thing that people want.
